title: Force on current - graphs of force vs current

content.question: Students design an experiment to determine the relationship between current in a wire and the force externed on the wire by a magnetic field. The students place a current-carrying wire of length <math alttext="2 centimeters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>cm</mi></math> a fixed distance above the north pole of a magnet. The magnet rests on an electronic balance. An ammeter is used to measure the current and the electronic balance is used to measure the magnetic force on the magnet. The students measure the effect of current on the magnetic force for two different magnets <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> and <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math> with magnetic fields <math alttext="B sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>B</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></msub></math> and <math alttext="B sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>B</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></msub></math>, respectively. The graph of their results is shown. Which of the following expressions correctly relates <math alttext="B sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>B</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></msub></math> to <math alttext="B sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>B</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></msub></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="B sub A equals 2 B sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>B</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><msub><mi>B</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub></math>
<math alttext="B sub A equals 4 B sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>B</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn><msub><mi>B</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub></math>
<math alttext="2 B sub A equals B sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><msub><mi>B</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>B</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub></math>
<math alttext="4 B sub A equals B sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4</mn><msub><mi>B</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>B</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="B sub A equals 2 B sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>B</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><msub><mi>B</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub></math>

topic.text: 12.3: Magnetic Fields of Current-Carrying Wires and the Biot-Savart Law

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
